column4: when you ctrl+z something in the terminal, does it get killed? or is it suspended? also what is the [1]+ for  when you use ctrl+z?
you stop the process and you're returned to the shell. you can type bg to run it as a background process or fg to return it as a foreground process
processes can chose to capture and ignore the kill, in which case you have to send them a SIGTERM (kill -9 <pid>)
I can reccomend having a look at the jobs manpage
